creator: tom@58k.com
text:
If you choose a context path that starts with a number, i.e. /10x, the jsp
compiler mangler code will generate code that starts package names with
the same 10x.   This will generate an error in the jsp compilation phase
because you will see a package statement like:

package 10x;

This will create a syntax error that you can't name a package starting with
a number. 

It worse that this.   Any segment of a path that is a number will not 
be mangled correctly.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Mangler needs to be fixed, probably it's better to do this in jasper34,
after refactoring, as the code is too complex. If anyone can submit a patch we
can still add it to 3.3.
Fixed, I'll check in later today.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
